  • Constructor Details

    • HelloController

      public HelloController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initilise the controller after the FXML file has been loaded.

      This method sets the full screen mode for the main scene, and initializes the visibility and state of the controls linked with the speed and the edit and save buttons.

      • If the scene is already available, it applies full screen directly.
      • Otherwise, it adds a listener to apply full screen as soon as the scene is available.
      • Hides and disables the controls related to the generation and resolution speed.
      • Disables the "edit mode" and "save" buttons.

    • GenerateMaze

      public void GenerateMaze()
      Generate a new maze based on user input.

      The type of maze (perfect or imperfect) is determined by the selected radio button. The maze dimensions and random seed are provided by the user. Validations are performed to ensure the inputs are valid.

      In case of an error (invalid dimensions or out-of-bounds speed), an error message is displayed.

      Once the maze is generated, the cells are displayed in a `GridPane`. If animation is enabled, a `ProgressBar` tracks the progress of the generation. At the end of the generation, the maze's entry and exit are initialized.

      Disables the edit and save buttons during generation.

    • resetMaze

      public void resetMaze()
      Resets the actual state of the maze and the graphical interface.

      This method is used to cancel an ongoing generation or resolution and clean the interface before starting a new operation.

      This method leaves the interface ready to host a new generation.

    • resetZoom

      public void resetZoom()

    • MousePressed

      public void MousePressed()
      Changes the mouse cursor to a closed hand when the mouse is pressed.

      Used generally to indicate that the user can drag or move an area.

    • ChooseMaze

      public void ChooseMaze()
      Starts the maze resolution process based on the selected method.

      This method:

      • checks that the edit mode is disabled (otherwise it blocks the resolution),
      • stops any ongoing animation (path or generation),
      • clears the progress bar,
      • redraws the maze,
      • instantiates a Resolve object to solve the maze,
      • retrieves the chosen resolution method (Tremaux, BFS, Hand on Wall),
      • executes the corresponding method,
      • displays an error if no path was found,
      • displays the time, the number of explored cells, and the length of the final path,
      • finally displays the path either all at once or step by step depending on the toggle.

    • showPathStepByStep

      public void showPathStepByStep(List<Case> path)
      Displays the current path in the maze grid by coloring each cell step by step. Each cell of the path is highlighted in red according to the specified speed.

      If the edit mode is enabled, the ongoing animation is stopped and reset. The animation speed is retrieved from the user input, with a default value of 100 ms. The speed must be between 10 and 100 ms, otherwise an error message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      path - Ordered list of cells (Cases) forming the path to animate. If the list is empty or null, the method does nothing.

    • generateMaze

      public static Maze generateMaze(int width, int height, String method, Integer seedOpt)
      Generates a maze using the specified method with given dimensions and an optional seed.
      Parameters:
      width - The width (number of columns) of the maze to generate.
      height - The height (number of rows) of the maze to generate.
      method - The maze generation method: "Parfait" for a perfect maze (no cycles), any other value for an imperfect maze.
      seedOpt - An optional integer used as a seed for random generation. If null, a random seed will be generated.
      Returns:
      A Maze object representing the generated maze.

    • printTerminal

      public static void printTerminal(Maze maze)
      Displays a textual representation of the maze in the terminal. This method uses Unicode characters to draw the walls of the maze according to the information contained in the Maze object passed as a parameter. The top and bottom borders as well as the junctions between walls are also drawn to form a coherent frame around the maze.
      Parameters:
      maze - The Maze object representing the maze to display. It must provide the width, height, and grid of cells via the getWidth(), getHeight(), and getMaze() methods.

    • printTerminal

      public static void printTerminal(Maze maze, List<Case> solutionPath)
      Displays a textual representation of the maze in the terminal, highlighting a solution path.

      This method draws the maze with Unicode characters to represent the walls, and displays the provided solution path in red as "â€¢" points.

      The maze is represented cell by cell, with walls to the west and south according to the information provided by the getWest() and getSouth() methods of each cell.

      The solution path is indicated by red points in the corresponding cells.

      Parameters:
      maze - The maze to display, containing the width, height, and grid of cells.
      solutionPath - The ordered list of cells forming the solution path to highlight.

    • saveMazeTerminal

      public static void saveMazeTerminal(Maze currentMaze, Database db, Scanner sc)
      Saves a maze in the database with a unique name provided by the user.

      This method prompts the user via the console to enter a unique name to save the maze. If the user does not provide a name (empty input), a default name is generated automatically, ensuring it is unique among the existing names in the database.

      If the entered name already exists, the user is prompted to enter another name until a unique name is obtained.

      Parameters:
      currentMaze - The maze to save.
      db - The Database object used for saving.
      sc - The Scanner used to read user input from the console.

    • SaveMaze

      public void SaveMaze()
      Saves the current maze in the database with the name specified by the user.

      This method checks that the text field containing the maze name is not empty, and that this name does not already exist in the list of saved mazes. If either of these conditions is not met, an error message is displayed. Otherwise, the maze is saved in the database via the `db` object.

      The method depends on a text field `MazeName` to retrieve the maze name, and on an instance `currentMaze` representing the current maze.

    • loadMaze

      public void loadMaze()
      Loads a maze from the database and updates the display.

      This method retrieves the selected maze name from the `SaveList` ComboBox, loads the corresponding maze from the database, and updates the graphical grid to display the loaded maze. It also updates the labels with information about the maze (size, seed, etc.).

    • deleteMaze

      public void deleteMaze()
      Deletes a maze from the database and updates the list of saved mazes.

      This method retrieves the selected maze name from the `SaveList` ComboBox, deletes the corresponding maze from the database, and updates the ComboBox to reflect the changes.

    • ChargeMaze

      public void ChargeMaze(String name)
      Charges a maze from the database and updates the display. Calculates the size of the cells, initializes the grid, and detects the entry and exit.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the maze to load.

    • setDatabase

      public void setDatabase(Database db)
      Defines the database used by the controller. This method sets the database object to be used for saving and loading mazes.
      Parameters:
      db - The Database object to use.

    • ReturnHomepage

      public void ReturnHomepage(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Returns to the homepage of the application.

      This method loads the "Homepage.fxml" file and sets it as the current scene.

      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggering the action.
